newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Blasts in central Russia kill two.
newsitem.headline: Blasts in central Russia kill two.

text.p: A 60-year-old woman was killed when an explosive device went off in her handbag in the central Russian city of Voronezh, Interfax news agency quoted police sources as saying on Friday.
In a separate incident in the central Russian Tambov region, a driver of a truck belonging to a local firm was killed and a security guard wounded in a grenade explosion.
Interfax said an unidentified attacker threw the grenade into the truck as it was passing by.

Bomb blasts are a common method of settling scores between rival gangs in Russia's criminal underworld. Massive illegal sales of arms and ammunition have led to many deaths, often as a result of mishandling explosive devices and guns.
Last month at least four people died and scores more were wounded in two railway station explosions in southern Russia, allegedly carried out by Chechen separatists.
